Business Architecture
The business architecture defines the business strategy, governance, organization, and key business processes.
Organization (<<Business Actor>>)
Description: Represents the organizational structure, roles, responsibilities, and reporting lines.
Examples:
• Hospital departments (Emergency, Radiology, Oncology) • Clinical staff roles (Physicians, Nurses, Pharmacists) • Administrative units (Finance, HR, Operations) • External entities (Insurance providers, Regulatory bodies) Business Process (<<Business Process>>) Description: Sequences of activities that deliver value to stakeholders.
Examples:
• Patient admission process • Medication administration workflow • Discharge planning process • Insurance claims processing • Clinical documentation workflow
Business Function (<<Business Function>>)
Description: Collections of related capabilities that enable the organization to execute its mission.
Examples:
• Patient care management • Clinical operations • Revenue cycle management • Supply chain management • Research and education
Business Service (<<Business Service>>)
Description: Value delivered to internal or external customers through business processes.
Examples:
• Outpatient care services • Laboratory testing services • Telehealth consultations • Patient education services • Home health services
